short_summary: Advance Contract Award Notice for: Operating the duck banding station at Lac Saint-Jean, Quebec, Canada.
description: Environment and Climate Change Canada requires the services of a Contractor to operate the duck banding station at Lac Saint-Jean for the summer period of 2024, 2025 and 2026. The Contract involves operating the duck banding station and collecting scientific data.",
full_summary:
# ACAN: Duck Banding at Lac Saint-Jean Station
## Tender Notice

The Government of Canada, Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC), is seeking the services of a contractor to operate the duck banding station at Lac Saint-Jean for the summer periods of 2024, 2025, and 2026.

### Tender Details
- **Tender Number:** 5000081826
- **Publication Date:** June 6, 2024
- **Tender Closing Date:** June 21, 2024, at 15:00:00
- **Expected Contract Start Date:** July 1, 2024
- **Expected Contract End Date:** June 30, 2025

### Service Requirements

ECCC requires the contractor to operate the duck banding station at Lac Saint-Jean, in the Péribonka River and Mistassini River sectors, for the duration of the contract. The contractor must perform the following tasks:

- Work preparation, including purchasing start-up equipment and conducting a site visit
- Construction and/or repair of cages
- Requesting authorization for scientific research from Parc national de la Pointe-Taillon
- Pre-baiting for fifteen days prior to the start of operations
- Installing ten cages
- Notifying conservation officers
- Capturing and banding ducks
- Daily data compilation
- Closing the cages
- Material storage
- Report production
- Shipping material to the Canadian Wildlife Service

### Reporting Requirements

The contractor must submit a final activity report electronically to the Project Manager at the end of each summer season.

### Contractual Constraints

- All work and deliverables must be performed in French.
- The contractor will not be reimbursed for actual travel and living expenses reasonably incurred in the performance of the work.
- The contractor must comply with the Waterfowl Banding Risk analysis.
- The contractor must house and feed the resource at the work site for the duration of the contract.

### Contract Award

This tender notice serves as an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN), indicating that a contract has been awarded to a contractor, as required by the federal regulations.

You may wish to view the full tender notice at the following link: 

- https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/39604/acan-5000081826-en.pdf
- https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/39604/pac-
